ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to converse, read, and listen to basic Italian.
I learned the basics of the Italian language.
I learned better study habits to learn a language. It taught me that I needed to study and practice almost every day. I also learned more about Italian culture.
I was introduced to the basics of Italian and began creating strategies to study and learn a language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is great at exposing students to conversational Italian and increasing their comfort level with the language.
My professor Federica Parodi was an amazing professor. She helped me learn a language from scratch.

The strength of this course was that it taught a lot of Italian in a short amount of time. For example, we covered lots of vocabulary words and multiple verb tenses. Another strength was that we did exercises in class where students received feedback from the professor. At times, however, it felt like there was too much material on a test which made that test daunting.

I liked the workload of the class. Given that the class met every day, I thought that the flexibility with outside-of-class assignments was helpful. It allowed me to complete the work on my own schedule instead requiring a certain amount of work every single day, especially because I often had particular days that were way busier than others due to the schedule of my other classes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course thoroughly. It was well taught and made engaging without a stressful atmosphere. I never dreaded having to go to class.
Yes, especially if they are interested in Italian language or culture, but I would also recommend it to students who are cautious about which language to take.
Yes. Italian is a great language with a great department.
Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to another student because you are able to learn a lot of a new language in such a short amount of time.
Yes, I believe this course was a good introductory language course if another student was interested in taking Italian.
